question: [File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: PendingClientResponse] [Response Overwrite] Can a late-arriving response overwrite an already-processed response, causing the same data to be processed twice? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: PendingClientResponse] [Error Response Handling] Can error responses in client_response be ignored or mishandled, causing the system to assume success when the request actually failed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [NotificationId Type] [ID Generation] Can the NotificationId u64 type be exhausted through rapid notification generation, causing ID wraparound and notification collision attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [NotificationId Type] [ID Prediction] Is NotificationId generated using a predictable sequence, allowing attackers to predict future notification IDs and pre-craft malicious responses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [DataPayload Enum] [Variant Size Imbalance] Does the large_enum_variant allow create memory layout issues where different variants have vastly different sizes, causing heap fragmentation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [DataPayload Enum] [Proof Validation Bypass] Are LedgerInfoWithSignatures in all payload variants validated for signature correctness and quorum certificates before being used? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [All Request Structs] [Version Type Overflow] Since Version is type-aliased to u64, can version arithmetic overflow in calculations like start_version + chunk_size? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [All Request Structs] [Epoch Type Overflow] Can Epoch values overflow during arithmetic operations like computing epoch differences or ranges? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [DataPayload Enum] [Fork Attack] Can a malicious peer provide ContinuousTransactionsWithProof from a forked chain by crafting valid-looking LedgerInfoWithSignatures from < 1/3 Byzantine validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [DataPayload Enum] [Epoch Rollback] Can an attacker provide old EpochEndingLedgerInfos with valid signatures to roll back the validator set to a compromised state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [DataPayload Enum] [State Poisoning] Can malicious StateValuesWithProof corrupt the state database during bootstrapping by providing proofs that verify against an old state root? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [DataPayload Enum] [Proof Reuse] Can the same LedgerInfoWithSignatures be reused across multiple DataPayload notifications to bypass freshness checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [All Request Types] [Version Skipping] Can crafting requests with gaps in version ranges cause critical transactions to be skipped during state sync? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [All Request Types] [Epoch Boundary Manipulation] Can requests that span epoch boundaries bypass validator set verification by mixing data from different epochs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [DataNotification Struct] [Ordering Violation] If notifications are delivered out of order due to network delays or malicious reordering, can this cause state transitions to be applied incorrectly? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [NotificationId Type] [Sequence Gap] Can missing notification IDs in the sequence (e.g., receiving ID 5 after ID 3, skipping ID 4) cause the system to wait indefinitely for the missing notification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [DataNotification Struct] [Duplicate Notification] If the same notification_id is sent twice with different data_payload values, which one is processed and can this cause state inconsistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [PendingClientResponse Struct] [Response Ordering] Can responses arriving out of FIFO order cause earlier requests to be processed with later responses, mixing up data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [DataPayload Enum] [Large Vector Attack] Can an attacker send EpochEndingLedgerInfos with a Vec containing millions of LedgerInfoWithSignatures to exhaust memory? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [DataPayload Enum] [Proof Size Explosion] Can TransactionListWithProofV2 or TransactionOutputListWithProofV2 contain excessively large proofs that exhaust memory during deserialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [StateValuesWithProofRequest Struct] [Index Range DoS] Can setting end_index to u64::MAX force loading of the entire state into memory, causing OOM crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [All Request Types] [Request Flooding] Can an attacker flood the system with millions of different request types to exhaust the request queue and block legitimate sync requests? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [DataPayload Enum] [Signature Verification Bypass] Are all LedgerInfoWithSignatures signatures verified against the current validator set before trusting the data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [DataPayload Enum] [Quorum Certificate Validation] Do all LedgerInfoWithSignatures have valid quorum certificates (> 2/3 voting power), or can < 1/3 Byzantine validators craft fake ledger infos? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [DataPayload Enum] [Merkle Proof Validation] Are StateValueChunkWithProof Merkle proofs validated against the correct state root before accepting state values? (Critical)
